data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3497183,"name":"Tom Corrigan","username":"tcorrigan5878","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/779978/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T22:41:35.125Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe are using SparkMAX controllers and Neo/Neo 550 motors for our swerve drive.  All the controllers have the latest firmware installed. The Rev Hardware client is up to date. All the wiring looks good. When we run each individual motor using the Hardware client everything works properly.  However as soon as we enable the robot ALL the turning controllers throw a sensor fault. The motor controllers are fine. The \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e bus is configured properly. All the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e devices are seen when the robot code is first activated. We’ve had this happen with two different code bases, one written in Java, the other in Python. Anyone have any ideas?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T22:41:35.125Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":52.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484359,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-controller-problem","display_username":"Tom Corrigan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-controller-problem/484359/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3497194,"name":"Kayla Toll","username":"pinksmore","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pinksmore/{size}/8625_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T22:48:57.157Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eIs the configuration or code base expecting the absolute encoders to plug directly into the top of the spark max?
